description.narrative: In April 2013, the Prime Minister of Vietnam issued the Decision No. 551/QD-TTg approving the Program 135 phase III which focuses on supporting infrastructure investment and production development in extreme hardship communes, border areas and safety zones. In order to implement this Decision, MARD, CEMA, MoF, MPI, and the Ministry of Construction issued a Joint Circular No. 05/2013/TTLT dated November 18, 2013 as an operating guidance for the Program 135. However, the Joint Circular No 05 only provides general principles. MARD assigned the Department of Cooperatives and Rural Development to research, consult and draft circulars and manuals guiding the production development. Because of governmental limited resources in the task, it is impossible for the Department to conduct surveys and consultation meetings with the program beneficiaries and stakeholders at communal and district levels. In response, the EMWGcore group members gathered together and discussed with MARD to provide both technical and financial support to fulfill the duty. Main reason why the EMWG supports this Department is to make the policy papers be more friendly-used and practical. Normally, policies are developed at the desk. They lack opinions, inputs and participation of local people who are beneficiaries and direct implementers of the program. If being consulted widely from national to grassroots levels, the policy papers will be more appropriate and practical to them. Objective of proposal: - To consult multi-stakeholders including EM beneficiaries, village/commune#s leaders, authorities at all levels, development practitioners on the implementation process/approach of program. This will help to analyze difficulties, unsuitability in Phase II and seek for recommendations for better implementation in Phrase III. - The survey results will serve as a basis for consultants and drafting committee to develop the circular and guidelines. Expected outcome: - Representatives of EM farmers, village heads, commune leaders and authorities at all level in three regions are directly consulted and their need and voices are reflected in the circular and guidelines; - Proven approach, successful process and model on production development developed by INGOs/VNGOs are recommended to be applied in the program 135 implementation; - Principles such as participation approach, gender sensitive, cultural diversity, climate change adaptation, market linkage and geographical differences are applied during the planning and implementation of the program; - The circular and guidelines on implementation process is simple and applicable for communeand district staffs. Consultation process and Methodology: The detail consultation process and methodology will be designed by consultants. However, they are expected to use participatory, cultural and gender sensitive approaches to ensure that all voice count.
